title: Can you finally do something about Champs with over 100% ban rate? Disable or plan next patch chang?
body:
There's consistently 3 to 4 champions rotating over a 100% ban rate. (Aphelios, Qiyana, Yasuo, Akali etc.)

There's absolutely no fucking excuse that a champion like Akali's been left to be a Perma ban for over a year. Why is there never any action taken when Champions get to this point?

Imo these champions should either be temporarily disabled or flagged for immediate changes in the next patch. They just tend to be too gane-ruining and remove the entire point of the ban phase.

replies.body: Over 100% banrate? So you are saying that champions that are somehow banned more times than games played? That is what over 100% banrate means. No champion is even close to a 80% banrate. There is no champion with a 100% banrate in league's history. Not even season 3 kassawin reached that milestone and he is the champion with the highest banrate of them all.

> [{quoted}](name=ZephyrDrake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pLo437TQ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-01-21T05:33:04.668+0000)
>
> Over 100% banrate? So you are saying that champions that are somehow banned more times than games played? That is what over 100% banrate means. No champion is even close to a 80% banrate. There is no champion with a 100% banrate in league's history. Not even season 3 kassawin reached that milestone and he is the champion with the highest banrate of them all.

Season 3 kass actually doesnt have the highest banrate. 

And you can have well over 100% banrate. Both teams can ban him, and remakes count towards bans while not affecting games played or win/pick rate.

Right now Aphelios has over 110% pick/ban in euw challenger according to more basic statistics sites. 

As far as not being close to 80%, yeah aphelios is masters+ globally.


If I remember correctly, most sites don't track banrate properly, since two bans counts as one total per match. Someone did a spreadsheet or something that properly analyzed banrates, and champs like akali and aphelios has well over 100% ban in total, as 200% is the pseudo-hard-cap, with remakes able to breach it.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pLo437TQ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2020-01-21T06:01:18.768+0000)
>
> Season 3 kass actually doesnt have the highest banrate. 

In Season 3 only one team could ban a champion instead of both. To compare in a sensible manner one needs to go by percent of games a champ is banned. By which metric Aphelios, while high, is does not reach the 90% mark for ban rate.

Aphelios reached 223% banrate on KR recently according to the Riot API.

2 teams = 2 possible bans, and it oddly counts bans from remakes/leaves as well, so it can pass 200%.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pLo437TQ,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2020-01-21T06:23:04.905+0000)
>
> Aphelios reached 223% banrate on KR recently according to the Riot API.
> 
> 2 teams = 2 possible bans, and it oddly counts bans from remakes/leaves as well, so it can pass 200%.

No, one site's way of calculating it concluded that there was that high of a ban rate from the games they collected as a sample. They added up the total number of bans and divided by the number of sampled games that were not remakes (but included the bans from the remakes when getting the total ban count).

A total stupid way of going about it.
None of these 4 really come close to 100%, especially Yasuo and Qiyana. Both I have played with and agaunst in numerous matches.
